gptanswer: We have $(q+4)(p+3)-(q+2)(p+1)=44$. We can distribute the $(q+4)$ and the $(q+2)$ to get $(p+3)(q+4)-(p+1)(q+2)=44$. We can combine like terms to get $(p+1)(q+4)-(p+3)(q+2)=44$. We can combine like terms again to get $(p+1)(q+4)-(p+1)(q+2)=44$. We can divide by $(p+1)(q+2)=44$ to get $p+q=\boxed{22}$.
